Flute in E♭, a minor third above concert flute.

Composers write for the "Tuba" and they don't care which one plays it

Large orchestral drums (kettledrums) often with a pedal to change tuning. A single staff may be used for multiple timpani (i.e. multiple tunings). Modern music is always written in C (non-transposing).
Dried donkey or horse jawbone traditionally used as a rattle in some Latin American countries.
Electronic Rotary Organ (usually means Hammond with Leslie Speaker)
A plucked sting instrument with lowest string tuned to G3 (written in C, non-transposing), an octave below the tenor ukulele.
Piccolo Balalaika (the smallest and rarest of the family)
Balalaika in fact the prima but a generic for simplicity
Prima Balalaika (the most commonly played of the family)
